comments.author: Kruw
comments.body: Taxation is theft. Regardless of Roger's attitude towards Bitcoin, he is being hunted down by a government who wants to steal his wealth. My support goes out to him.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I'd have to watch the entire interview first. So far, however, and although this man has always been so full of himself, I don't think it's fair. I don't know the nitty-gritty of the law and the facts of his particular case/s, but every country in the world has rich and powerful people who are also tax evaders themselves. Not a single one of them is sentenced to more than a hundred years simply because of it. So, if Ver will face 109 years in prison for it, it's certainly not just about tax evasion. Quote from: Eclipse33 on December 11, 2024, 01:33:14 AMA man who is peaceful, not a US citizen and according to Roger the claims are pure fabrication. If Ver renounced his US citizenship only in 2014 and yet he accumulated his vast wealth in Bitcoin years earlier as a US citizen without paying taxes, is he not liable for tax evasion?

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: QuoteIf Ver renounced his US citizenship only in 2014 and yet he accumulated his vast wealth in Bitcoin years earlier as a US citizen without paying taxes, is he not liable for tax evasion?Per US tax codes he IS liable for tax evasion. When renouncing his US citizenship he also owes an 'exit tax' (several other countries have the same thing) and even more to the point - he is liable per the tax codes as they were during the years in question. Just because the codes have changed since then make no difference tho Ver is insisting it's 'not fair' because penalties for some things were lowered since then.
